name: Comparison Table
description: Structured side-by-side table comparing 2-4 options, products, approaches, or scenarios across multiple criteria rows. Uses column headers for each option and row headers for criteria, with optional checkmarks, icons, or rating indicators.
components: Table heading: $heading-04 above the table describing the comparison context
Column headers: $heading-03 in $text-01, one per option being compared, with optional $blue-60 highlight for recommended option
Row headers (criteria): $body-short-01 bold in $text-01, leftmost column
Cell content: $body-short-01 in $text-02, or icon/checkmark indicators
Checkmark indicator: Carbon checkmark icon in $green-60 for supported, dash in $text-05 for unsupported
Recommended column highlight: $blue-10 background on the entire column, $blue-60 header accent
Zebra striping: alternating $ui-01 and $ui-background row backgrounds
rules: Maximum 4 comparison columns — more columns compress cell width below readability thresholds on A4
Criteria rows (row headers) use $body-short-01 bold — scan-friendly left column anchors the comparison
Cell content should be concise: single values, checkmarks, or 1-line descriptions — not paragraphs
If one option is recommended, highlight its column with $blue-10 background and $blue-60 header bottom border
Use zebra striping ($ui-01 alternating with $ui-background) for tables with more than 5 criteria rows
Column widths should be equal for compared options; criteria column (leftmost) can be wider
Table must have a descriptive heading ($heading-04) providing context for what is being compared
Use Carbon checkmark/close icons instead of text 'Yes'/'No' for binary criteria — faster to scan

printBehavior.pagePosition: flexible — comparison table should not break across pages
printBehavior.bleedHandling: no bleed — table stays within column bounds

accessibilityNotes: Use <th scope='col'> for option headers and <th scope='row'> for criteria — both dimensions need header association
Checkmark/dash icons must have aria-label (e.g., 'Supported' / 'Not supported') — icons alone are inaccessible
Recommended column highlight ($blue-10) must not rely on color alone — add text like 'Recommended' in the header
Add <caption> element summarizing the comparison context for screen readers
antiPatterns: Never exceed 4 comparison columns — narrow columns with wrapped text become unreadable on print
Never use paragraph-length cell content — comparison tables are for at-a-glance scanning, not detailed prose
Never omit row headers — without criteria labels, the table is just a grid of disconnected values
Never highlight multiple columns as 'recommended' — the purpose of highlighting is singular emphasis
Never mix icon-based and text-based indicators in the same table — choose one style (checkmarks or text) and use it consistently
